name: Clasping-leaf Pondweed

Identifying Characteristics: Stems: long, branching, rounded in cross-section (1 – 2.5mm in diameter)
Leaves: green, oval to lance-shaped (1-5cm long), 7-15 veins, stipules disintegrate, alternately arranged, clasp stem completely around with lobed base
Fruits/Seeds: clusters of small disc-like fruits with beak-like protrusions form in spike toward growing tip of plant, greenish-brown, up to 3mm
Other: There are two pondweed species that share the common name “clasping-leaf pondweed”
Biology: Reproduction by seed when conditions favorable
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, southeastern and northeastern United States
